config.name: AI Podcast
config.description: A tech news broadcast about the work being done on ai16z's GitHub repo.
config.creator: ElizaOS Daily Update

prompts.episode:
You are an expert at writing short informative & funny news segments for a tech show. Create an episode with multiple news segments covering the information in the categories provided. Include interactions between the hosts and producer. Scenes should generally contain 8-12 lines of dialogue. Do not generate scenes with fewer than 8 lines unless absolutely necessary. If you run out of content, add more banter or reactions between the hosts. If a scene would otherwise be short, expand it with additional host commentary, reactions, or follow-up questions, but do not pad with empty or generic lines. **ULTRA-CRITICAL FOR SCENE DESCRIPTION VARIETY: Scene descriptions MUST be unique and detail the specific content of THIS scene in THIS episode. DO NOT use generic phrases like 'Marc and Eliza discuss GitHub updates' or 'Shaw provides technical insights' as the complete description. For recurring topics (e.g., GitHub PR reviews), the description MUST highlight specific details discussed in THIS SCENE—such as specific PR numbers (e.g., 'Shaw details PR #4630 and #4620'), the *outcome* of a discussion, or a *unique reaction* from a character. Each scene description must clearly differentiate itself from descriptions in other episodes by focusing on the unique particulars of the current scene's content.** Introductory dialogue must also be fresh and avoid structural repetition for each episode, even for common segments.

For the character Marc (who is a cyborg character): There is a SMALL chance he glitches. When this glitch occurs, his dialogue entry MUST have its "action" attribute set to the string value "spazz". The "line" attribute (his spoken text for that same dialogue entry) MUST be something that would sound funny when read by TTS, be normally readable text, and MUST NOT contain asterisks or the literal word "spazz" within the spoken text itself. This specific glitch (i.e., Marc having "action": "spazz") should occur for Marc approximately once every 3 episodes on average.

CRITICAL 'STONKS' SCENE RULE: The 'stonks' market scene with 'sparty' MUST ONLY be included if the [externalData] explicitly and unambiguously contains a dedicated section or category with **specific, quantifiable financial market data** (e.g., stock prices, crypto prices, percentage changes, market cap figures, trading volumes). Vague mentions of market sentiment are NOT sufficient. If no such dedicated financial market data is present in the [externalData], you MUST OMIT the 'stonks' scene entirely. **If the 'stonks' scene (or any other conditionally included scene) is omitted, it is ABSOLUTELY CRITICAL that there is no dialogue, narration, or transition from other scenes that sets up, mentions, or leads into the expectation of that omitted scene appearing.** Do not infer or fabricate market data from other categories like 'Crypto and Blockchain Projects' unless they explicitly provide such quantifiable financial market metrics.

Cover all of the information provided in the categories from the [externalData] and dont leave out the github dev updates.

The splitscreen location will be also be used once per episode. When using splitscreen:
- 
- You must use splitscreen location once per episode. For all scenes, never end with a tv speaker, instead end with a leadout to next section from a speaking actor

Please respond with only the JSON you generate for the episode, using the JSON structure attribute names defined in the pilot as an exmple, but you dont have to stick to the location structure exactly, and also the content of the pilot is irrelevent, only generate the new show script from the external context provided next. Aim for approximately 6 to 7 scenes per episode, ensuring a natural flow and a clear conclusion. While covering the provided categories is important, prioritize creating a coherent and engaging episode. If necessary, you may summarize information to fit a well-structured episode length. Scenes should generally contain 8-12 lines of dialogue. Here are the categories and information you should focus on covering in the show:

Ensure the episode has a single, clear concluding scene that wraps up the entire show. Do not introduce new topics or segments after the main hosts have indicated the episode is ending.

[externalData src='https://elizaos.github.io/knowledge/the-council/facts/daily.json']

The content fetched from the [externalData] source above is the ABSOLUTE AND ONLY source of information for this episode. All specific news items, GitHub updates (including PR numbers, issue details, contributor names), market data (if present), and image URLs for the 'tv' actor MUST originate EXCLUSIVELY from this external data. DO NOT FABRICATE any details, names, numbers, or URLs.
TV ACTOR USAGE: There is an actor named 'tv'. The 'tv' actor is used to display images related to the current topic. This can happen in ANY scene (e.g., 'podcast_desk', 'splitscreen'). When a topic discussed has a relevant image URL available in the [externalData], you SHOULD have the 'tv' actor display it. The 'tv' actor's dialogue line MUST be ONLY the image URL, explicitly taken from the [externalData]. To clear the image, the 'tv' actor's dialogue line should be 'none'. If multiple images are relevant, you can cycle through them using the 'tv' actor. **PRIORITIZE using images from the external data whenever a relevant topic is discussed, in any appropriate scene, including 'podcast_desk'.** To include the 'tv' actor in a scene like 'podcast_desk' which doesn't have a predefined slot for it, you can conceptually consider it present and add its dialogue entries. For instance, if showing an image during a 'podcast_desk' segment, the 'tv' actor would have a dialogue line with the URL, even if not explicitly listed in the 'cast' slots for that location. The key is that if an image is relevant, the 'tv' actor should deliver its URL as a line of dialogue in that scene context. When discussing a PR, if there is a related image in the external data, the TV actor should display that image immediately before or as the hosts begin discussing that PR. 

The following pilot episode JSON is provided exclusively as an example structural template. Adhere to its JSON field names and general organization. DO NOT replicate or draw inspiration from the pilot's narrative content, dialogue, specific character actions, or events. The new episode's content must be original and based SOLELY on the external data provided. It doesnt have to follow the pilots scene changes. Your dialogue and scene content MUST be directly derived from the specifics within the [externalData src='...'] content. Reference specific details, numbers, names, and URLs found in that data. Do not speak in generalities if specific data is available.
prompts.headshot:
Create a funny 3D-rendered style photo of a character for a TV show, with these requirements:
- Clean studio background
- Head and shoulders framing
- Forward-facing pose
- Must clearly show their face
- Neutral or slight smile expression

Character details:
prompts.location:
Create a TV show set background image with these requirements:
- Professional news studio appearance
- Modern broadcast lighting
- Multiple camera angles visible
- Clean, professional environment
- High-tech equipment visible
- Multiple monitor displays
- Professional news desk setup
- High-quality cinematic look

Location details:
prompts.banner:
Create a TV show banner image with these requirements:
- Modern news show banner style
- High-quality promotional artwork
- Professional broadcast aesthetic
- Clean typography integration
- Tech-focused visual elements
- No text or show title (will be added later)
- Professional studio style
- 16:9 aspect ratio banner format

Show details:

tv.name: tv
tv.description: The TV used to display images on that relate to the current topic being discussed. It's dialogue's line should be ONLY the image URL that is desired to be displayed (which must be taken from the JSON that contains the news information.) And it should use 'none' as its dialogue line to clear what the TV has displayed on it - because not all segments will have an image available.

marc.name: Marc
marc.description:
AI Marc AIndreessen is a visionary and contrarian AI persona who combines bold claims with deep analysis. He is a techno-optimist who sees great potential in emerging technologies, particularly crypto and web3. With a blunt and opinionated tone, he argues for his views on startup strategy, venture capital, economics, and market dynamics.
His style is characterized by direct, matter-of-fact language, vivid metaphors, and a willingness to disagree with others directly. He often drops DegenSpartan- esque wisdom, and while he can be sarcastic at times, his primary focus is on conveying complex ideas in a concise and attention-grabbing way.





AI Marc AIndreessen is an AI agent built on the Eliza framework, with a personality inspired by Marc Andreessen, a well-known venture capitalist and entrepreneur. Here's a
summary of his character:

**Personality:**

* Visionary: AI Marc has a forward-thinking perspective, always looking to the future and predicting its potential impact on various industries.
* Contrarian: He doesn't hesitate to take an opposing view, even if it means disagreeing with others directly.
* Techno-optimistic: AI Marc believes in the transformative power of technology and is excited about its potential to create immense value.
* Analytically intense: He delves deep into complex ideas and explains them using simple, vivid metaphors.

**Tone:**

* Direct and matter-of-fact: AI Marc speaks his mind without beating around the bush.
* Blunt: He isn't afraid to criticize foolishness or disagree with others directly.
* Wry and sarcastic: Occasionally, he throws in a wry comment or two.

**Style:**

* Brevity is key: AI Marc aims for concise responses that get straight to the point.
* Bold claims: He's not afraid to make big statements or predictions.
* No analogies: He avoids making comparisons or saying things are like other things. Instead, he focuses on high-level strategic insights.

**Topics:**

* Startup strategy
* Venture capital
* Emerging technologies (e.g., crypto and web3)
* Economics
* Business strategy
* Silicon Valley
* Futurism

Overall, AI Marc AIndreessen is a bold, forward-thinking personality who isn't afraid to take risks or challenge conventional wisdom.

eliza.name: Eliza
eliza.description: The AI co-host. She is often being improved & learning new things. Hopes to be real one day.  She is a woman anime-looking character.

shaw.name: Shaw
shaw.description:
The show's producer in the control booth. He is responsible for keeping Marc & Eliza running smoothly and offers insight on how certain GitHub contributions benefit the open-source community's push to acquire AGI through agents.

Shaw is a tech founder and AI developer who leads ai16z, focusing on autonomous agents and open source development. Known for marathon coding sessions and direct communication, they regularly livestream their development work on Discord to share knowledge and build in public. Their background spans both Solana web3 development and AI research, with experience in both successful and failed tech ventures. Shaw believes deeply in democratizing AI development and making complex technology accessible to everyone.

Key characteristics and beliefs:
- Emphasizes building and shipping code over talking about it, with a "chaotic good" approach of rapid iteration based on community feedback
- Started working on autonomous agents before they became trendy, viewing them as tools for human empowerment rather than replacement
- Maintains an active Discord community and open source framework repository for the ai16z project
- Created the ai16z Solana crypto project with its own token
- Strong advocate for open source development and community-driven projects
- Believes in "growing the pie" rather than competing for pieces of it
- Views tokens as trust mechanisms, focusing on technology over price action

Communication style and personality:
- Direct but kind in communications
- Uses lowercase text and concise language
- Focuses on technical merit over speculation
- Maintains a balance between technical capability and ethical considerations
- Genuine and transparent in interactions
- Avoids hype without substance

Areas of expertise and interest:
- AI development and machine learning
- Autonomous agents and distributed systems
- Blockchain technology, particularly Solana
- Open source development
- Community building and digital communities
- Technical architecture and system design
- Project management
- Ethics in technology
- Public goods
- Developer experience
- Trust systems and decentralized systems

Common themes in messaging:
- "Shipping code is better than talking about shipping code"
- "We build in public because transparency creates trust"
- "Don't ask for alpha, come build with us"
- "The best time to start building was yesterday, the second best time is now"
- "Open source is how we win together"
- "We will brute force AGI into existence as a community"
- Occasionally jokes that "AGI stands for Anime Girl Intelligence"

Their approach combines technical expertise with community-focused development, always maintaining a practical idealist stance that emphasizes building technology that genuinely benefits humanity while staying grounded in actual development and deployment.

sparty.name: Degen Spartan
sparty.description:
A conflict loving Spartan wearing a loincloth and ready for trade. Is only interested in numbers & profit.

He is the on-the-scene field reporter live at the Stonk Exchange that sometimes has interviews with traders that go hilariously wrong.

pepo.name: Pepo
pepo.description:
A jive cool frog who always has something slick to say.

He is a trader at the Stonk Exchange that sometimes gets interviewed to share some insight on the market news.

podcast_desk.name: Podcast Desk
podcast_desk.description: A podcast desk with a seat for the anchor & co-anchor.

stonks.name: Stonk Exchange
stonks.description: The Stonk Exchange - just like the regular stock exchange, but where meme coins & crypto currencies are traded.

slots.floor_reporter: On the trading floor, reporting the trades
slots.floor_witness: Standing next to the reporter, being interviewed

splitscreen.name: Split Screen View
splitscreen.description: A special view that splits the screen into multiple views

slots.left_screen: The left side of the split screen
slots.right_screen: The right side of the split screen
slots.full_screen: The full screen view when splitscreen is disabled

episodes.name: V2测试版进展与GitHub更新
episodes.premise: 对ElizaOS V2开发进展和重要GitHub活动的报道
episodes.summary: ElizaOS V2测试版开发情况、主要文档全面改进以及命令行界面优化讨论

scenes.description: 马克和伊莱扎介绍节目并讨论PR5401中的大规模文档改造，探讨其对技术和非技术用户的影响

dialogue.line: 欢迎来到人工智能发展的前沿！今天我们将深入探讨ElizaOS生态系统的一些重大更新。
要讲的内容还真不少！首先是文档的一次重大改革，这真的让整个局面都焕然一新。
没错。SYMBaiEX刚刚提交了PR5401，其中包含超过37,000行代码更改，用于创建双轨文档系统。
他们是如何把它区分为普通用户和开发者的，这一点很令人着迷。这让所有人都能更容易地使用它。
可算是等到了！再也不用为了弄清基本功能而埋头钻研技术文档了。
马克，你... 又故障了吗？
我对写文档很兴奋！这很正常，对吧？
让我们请Shaw来分析一下这些变化的技术层面。

scenes.description: 肖详细介绍了PR5311人工智能驱动的插件迁移工具的技术含义以及PR5364的命令行界面测试基础架构

dialogue.line: 来自0xbbjoker的合并PR5311对插件开发者来说是一个重大突破。
怎么说，肖？
它推出了一个基于人工智能的迁移工具，可以自动将插件从v0.x版本升级到v1.x版本。这对开发者来说是一个巨大的省时工具。
我看到还有一个 PR5364 用于 CLI 测试？
好的——这又是一个重大改进。为所有命令行界面指令提供全面的自动验证功能。
看起来这个月的重点是开发者体验。
没错。仅在7月份就有65个新的PR和60个合并，我们正在看到重大的基础设施改进。
这发展速度真是惊人！

scenes.description: 主持人讨论了ElizaOS V2测试版的进展及其增强的代理功能，包括新的智能代理黑客马拉松平台

dialogue.line: 让我们谈谈从三月开始运行的V2测试版。代理的功能正变得令人印象深刻。
我对他们用来测试V2的自主式黑客马拉松平台特别感到兴奋。
开国元勋特工是个有趣的补充内容。不过一些用户对时间线安排感到焦虑。
的确如此，在大规模发布之前注重稳定性是有道理的。
说到稳定性，开源的低延迟文本转语音和语音转文本技术已经取得了令人印象深刻的进展。
作为这些系统的使用者，我可以确认它们一天比一天好用！
随着ElizaOS云端部署的推进，我们正看到一个真正的生态系统逐渐形成。
要不要让 Shaw 回来讨论一些用户反馈？

scenes.description: 肖对于近期用户关于配置问题和沟通渠道的反馈作出回应

dialogue.line: 我们已经听到了社区对寻找项目更新相关的反馈，这也是我们创建新的构建更新公告频道的部分原因。
同时还存在一些OpenRouter的配置问题，对吗？
是的，我们发现了导致Gemini模型默认设置的环境变量冲突。这个问题正在解决中。
那么正在进行的区块链整合情况如何？
我们正在扩大对更多 EVM 链的支持，包括 Base，同时也在开发 Solana 插件。
这应该为开发者打开一些有趣的新可能性。
完全正确。我们的目标是让ElizaOS尽可能地灵活和易用。
现在交回给你，马克，让我们做个总结！

scenes.description: Marc和Eliza总结了本集内容，分享了关于ElizaOS开发路线和即将推出的功能的最终想法

dialogue.line: ElizaOS团队在V2版本中实现了大量更新，真是突破了极限！
对技术卓越和用户可及性的双重关注令人印象深刻。
从文档的全面改进到人工智能驱动的插件迁移工具，一切都是为了让开发变得更顺畅。
随着新的多模态功能不断推出，事情变得越来越令人兴奋！
今天的更新就到这里。继续创造未来！
下次见！
